metadata.dcterms:title: Cardio-respiratory Function, School Age Abilities and Quality of Life in Extremely Low Birth Weight Infants
metadata.dcterms:creator: MacLean, Joanna
Hendson, Leonora
Adatia, Ian
Majaesic, Carina
Lovering, Andrew
Thompson, Richard
Nicholas, David
Thebaud, Bernard
Stickland, Michael
metadata.dcterms:description: This study examined cardio-respiratory function, school age abilities and quality of life in a large cohort of children 8 to 12 years of age born extremely preterm (EP).
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
infant, extremely premature
exercise test
quality of life
neurobehaviour
infant
cohort studies
pediatrics
intensive care units, neonatal
respiratory function
ventilatory response

Thorax. 2016;71(11):1012-1019. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207736., doi, 10.1136/ thoraxjnl-2015-207736, http://thorax.bmj.com/content/early/2016/06/03/thoraxjnl-2015-207736.abstract
metadata.dcterms:type: Questionnaire data; Interview data; Clinical data; Anthropometric data; Experimental data; Physiological data
metadata.dcterms:source: Child Sleep Habits Questionnaire (CSHQ); Child Health Questionnaire (CHQ) - Parent Report; Child Behaviour Check List (CBCL); Parent Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Child Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Adolescent Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Asthma Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL)
